name: COMMONWEALTH of Pennsylvania v. Donald TERRY, Appellant (three cases)

judges: JONES, former C. J., took no part in the decision of this case.
parties: COMMONWEALTH of Pennsylvania v. Donald TERRY, Appellant (three cases).

opinions.text:
OPINION OF THE COURT
PER CURIAM:
The court being equally divided, the judgments of sentence are affirmed.
JONES, former C. J., took no part in the decision of this case.
opinions.author: PER CURIAM:

attorneys: Louis G. F. Retaceo, Geo. W. Berkelbach, III, Nicholas A. Clemente, Philadelphia, for appellant.
F. Emmett Fitzpatrick, Dist. Atty., Steven H. Goldblatt, Asst. Dist. Atty., Chief, Appeals Div., Harry M. Spaeth, Jr., Philadelphia, for appellee.
casebody.head_matter:
373 A.2d 453
COMMONWEALTH of Pennsylvania v. Donald TERRY, Appellant (three cases).
Supreme Court of Pennsylvania.
Argued July 1, 1975.
Decided June 1, 1977.
Louis G. F. Retaceo, Geo. W. Berkelbach, III, Nicholas A. Clemente, Philadelphia, for appellant.
F. Emmett Fitzpatrick, Dist. Atty., Steven H. Goldblatt, Asst. Dist. Atty., Chief, Appeals Div., Harry M. Spaeth, Jr., Philadelphia, for appellee.
